definitions.definition: a place that is a popular destination for vacations or recreation, or which is frequented for a particular purpose.
synonyms: vacationland; Moreretreat; spa; onsen; informaltourist trap "a seaside resort"

definitions.definition: the tendency of a place to be frequented by many people.
the action of turning to and adopting a strategy or course of action, especially a disagreeable or undesirable one, so as to resolve a difficult situation.
examples: Germany and Italy tried to resolve their economic and social failures by resort to fascism
synonyms: utilizing "settle the matter without resort to legal proceedings"

definitions.definition: a strategy or course of action that may be adopted in a difficult situation.
synonyms: hope "strike action is our last resort"

definitions.definition: turn to and adopt (a strategy or course of action, especially a disagreeable or undesirable one) so as to resolve a difficult situation.
examples: the duke was prepared to resort to force if negotiation failed
synonyms: sink to "I don't have to resort to such underhanded tricks"

definitions.definition: go often or in large numbers to.
examples: local authorities have a duty to provide adequate sites for gypsies “residing in or resorting to” their areas
